content.question: Which of the following numerical expressions gives the number of particles in <math alttext="2.0 grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="N e" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Ne</mtext></mrow></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 6.0, times 10 to the 23 power particles per mole, and denominator 2.0 grams, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>23</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>particles</mtext><mtext></mtext><mtext> /mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 6.0, times 10 to the 23 power particles per mole, and denominator 20.18 grams per mole, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>23</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>particles/mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>20.18</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2.0 grams, and denominator 20.18 grams per mole, end fraction, times open parenthesis, 6.0, times 10 to the 23 power particles per mole, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>20.18</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>6.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>23</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>particles/mol</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 20.18 grams per mole, and denominator 2.0 grams, end fraction, times open parenthesis, 6.0, times 10 to the 23 power particles per mole, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>20.18</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>6.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>23</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>particles/mol</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 2.0 grams, and denominator 20.18 grams per mole, end fraction, times open parenthesis, 6.0, times 10 to the 23 power particles per mole, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>20.18</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>mol</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>6.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>23</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>particles/mol</mtext><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.B: Identify an appropriate theory, definition, or mathematical relationship to solve a problem.
